title: Messi's assists propel Miami to 1st MLS Cup title
content: A brace of assists from Lionel Messi secured a first-ever MLS Cup title for Inter Miami CF after defeating the Vancouver Whitecaps 3-1 on Saturday.

title: Texas Tech captures Big 12 title, likely CFP bye

title: Iowa St. hands No. 1 Purdue historic home loss

title: Salah slams Liverpool treatment, hints at Jan. exit

title: Packers WR Reed off IR, set for return vs. Bears

content: Under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, those ‚Äúblunders‚Äù are being corrected, says BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia.

content: The court noted that the accused officer caused a loss to the government exchequer to the tune of ‚Çπ1.20 crore.

Venugopal attended the closed door meeting at Congress Parliamentary Party (CPP) chairperson Sonia Gandhi‚Äôs official residence

title: Local body polls too complex to be a referendum on LDF government in Kerala
content: An analysis of the previous three-tier local body elections reveals that regional issues and candidates outweigh State-level political dynamics, particularly in the grama panchayats and block panchayats. State politics, however, is reflected in the district panchayat divisions, municipalities, and Corporations

content: Mr. Nadda also accuses the Soren government of siphoning off funds from the mining of natural resources¬†

content: The capability has been developed in collaboration with IIT-Hyderabad under Project PRABAL (Portable Robotic Printer for Printing Bunkers and Accessories) and marks a powerful advancement in sustainable and mission-ready construction along the northern borders

title: Nothing like one‚Äôs own country, says Sunali after returning from Bangladesh
content: Four others, including Sunali‚Äôs husband who were allegedly pushed into Bangladesh in June earlier this year, are still awaiting their release from Bangladesh.

title: Police objects to transferring Kodakara heist case to PMLA court
content: The case, involving a ‚Çπ3.5 crore robbery on April 3, 2021 allegedly for funding a poll campaign, has resulted in 23 arrests and recoveries exceeding ‚Çπ1.5 crore.

title: Prison authorities who abuse disabled prisoners to be penalised under RPwD Act: SC
content: The order, based on a plea highlighting deaths of Saibaba and Stan Swamy, directs States to change their prison rules to provide assistive devices and enhanced family visitation rights to prisoners, undertrials with special needs

title: Delhi HC directs rival PMK factions to approach competent civil court to settle internal disputes
content: It says the Election Commission of India has no power or jurisdiction to give any finding with respect to internal disputes arising between rival sections within an unrecognised political party

title: Women experience amplified health risks due to rising heat: MSSRF study in seven States
content: Most women in extremely hot districts reported fatigue, dizziness, UTIs, mentrual cycle disruption in the summer months; higher wage losses, heightened stress, insomnia, and violence were also common

title: Nitish Kumar launches JD(U) membership drive
content: The party has set a target of over 1 crore primary members, for which an intensive campaign will be run at the booth level.

title: Assam reinforces two-child policy for govt. jobs, electoral participation
content: The ceiling has been revised to three children for Scheduled Tribes, Scheduled Castes, ‚ÄúTea Garden Tribes‚Äù, and the Matak and Moran communities

content: K.G. Shivanandan alleges the ED derailed the probe, ignored key witnesses, and acted as a political tool of the BJP

content: The Chief Minister‚Äôs advisor, Nasir Aslam Wani, also suggested that the examination should be delayed until the issue of age relaxation, currently pending the lieutenant governor‚Äôs approval, is addressed

content: An expert committee to visit the site soon, and further action will be taken based on the panel‚Äôs report

content: Says BJP will lose more than half its sitting seats; terms allegations by BJP State president Rajeev Chandrasekhar ‚Äòpolitical bankruptcy‚Äô

title: Atal-Modi Suparipaalana Yatra in A.P. from December 11
content: The State-wide event is being organised as part of Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee‚Äôs birth centenary celebrations¬†

title: Congress terms CM‚Äôs claims on Kochi Corporation far from reality
content: The Chief Minister is trying to whitewash the LDF, which had failed to address basic infrastructure issues in the city during its five years of governing the Kochi Corporation, says Ernakulam DCC chief

title: Balagopal sees malicious intent in UDF MPs' questions in Parliament
content: He says Left Democratic Front aims at further strengthening the local self-government bodies by focussing on tourism development, job creation, and boosting the production sector

title: ‚ÄòSecular‚Äô and ‚Äòsocialist‚Äô not needed in Preamble, says BJP MP
content: These were added during Emergency and were not part of the original Constitution, says Bhim Singh, who has introduced a private member‚Äôs Bill seeking their removal

title: Expert team to probe NH collapse in Kollam
content: Sole responsibility of  NH collapse on NHAI and construction agency, says Finance Minister, while visiting the accident site

title: Governor to inaugurate Telangana Global Rising Summit, Chief Minister to deliver keynote address
content: The summit is an initiative to attract investments and secure Telangana‚Äôs economic future, the Deputy Chief Minister said

title: IndiGo Crisis Highlights: Hundreds Of Flights Cancelled Today
content: The cancellation and delay of all domestic flights of IndiGo departing from Delhi entered the fifth day on Saturday. The issue has affected tens of thousands of passengers who are worried about extended delays and soaring travel costs.

title: 5-Year-Old Boy Mauled To Death By Leopard In Tamil Nadu
content: In yet another shocking case of humanwildlife conflict in the Anamalai hill region, a five-year-old boy was mauled to death by a leopard in Valparai of Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore district on Saturday, police officials said.

title: Babri Masjid Row: BJP Leader Conducts Bhumi Puja For Murshidabad Ram Temple
content: In the backdrop of the laying of the foundation stone of Babri Masjid in Murshidabad, BJP leader Sakharov Sarkar and his party wing on Saturday did Bhumi Puja for the establishment of a replica of Ayodhya's Ram 'Lala' Temple.

title: Inside India's Pilot Safety Rules At The Centre Of IndiGo Meltdown
content: India's stricter pilot fatigue management rules hit IndiGo hard this week as it had failed to plan for changes in its rosters, throwing operations of the country's biggest airline into disarray and disrupting air travel across the country.

title: Priti Adani Calls On Adani University Graduates To Power India's Rise With Purpose
content: Adani University hosted its 2nd Convocation Ceremony on Saturday at the University Auditorium in Shantigram, celebrating the achievements of 87 graduating students, including three distinguished university medallists.

title: Man Dies By Suicide After Killing His Children In UP's Bijnor: Cops
content: A man allegedly poisoned his son and daughter before consuming poison himself following a dispute with his wife here on Saturday, police said, adding that all three died.

title: New Rules Threaten Aravalli Range: 90% Hills May Lose Protection
content: The Aravalli range, one of the world's oldest mountain systems, stretches from Delhi in the north to Gujarat in the south, with nearly two-thirds of its expanse passing through 15 districts of Rajasthan.

title: Mumbai Airport Introduces Extra Measures To Cope With IndiGo Cancellations
content: As disruptions across the IndiGo network continue, the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) in Mumbai saw 146 cancellations until 8 pm on Saturday.

title: Aviation Regulator's Notice To IndiGo CEO Over "Massive" Flight Disruptions
content: India's aviation regulator has issued a show-cause notice to IndiGo's Chief Executive Officer, holding him accountable for a week-long operational crisis that left thousands of passengers stranded across the country.

title: "Friend, Philosopher, Guide": Minister As Delhi Forms 2 Pollution Panels
content: New Delhi: Two days after Chief Minister Rekha Gupta held a high-level review meeting, the Delhi government on Saturday formally notified the constitution of a new Expert Group on Air Pollution Mitigation and a High-Level Implementation Committee.

title: "95% Network Connectivity Re-Established, Signs Of Improvement": IndiGo
content: After days of chaos triggered by the disruption of flight operations, IndiGo has shared a big update. The airline has reestablished 95 per cent of its network connectivity in terms of destinations.

title: Crowd Control, Separate Entry: Conditions For Vijay's Rally, 1st Since Stampede
content: A strict cap on the number of participants, demarcated enclosures and monitored entry are some of the conditions enforced by the Puducherry Police as TVK chief and actor Vijay is set to hold a political rally in the Union Territory on Tuesday.

title: Day 5 Of IndiGo Crisis: Passengers Reach Destination, Their Bags Don't
content: As the IndiGo crisis entered day five, passengers in Mumbai complained about poor communication and their baggage being lost.

title: Russian Couple, Man Who Lost Mother: Passengers Stranded Amid IndiGo Chaos
content: IndiGo's disruptions were reduced at the Chennai airport on Saturday after the Centre relaxed some Flight Duty Time Limitations, but several passengers remained stranded following cancellations,

title: 2 Men Rape Girl, Record Act To Threaten Family In UP, Arrested: Cops
content: Two men allegedly raped a 13-year-old girl here, recorded the act and demanded Rs 5 lakh from her family, threatening to circulate the video, police said.

title: Woman Mauled To Death By Tiger Near Her House In Uttarakhand: Police
content: A woman was killed allegedly in a tiger attack while collecting fodder near her house in a village within the Kalagarh Tiger Reserve area of Uttarakhand's Pauri Garhwal district, police said on Saturday.

title: Man, 25, Arrested For Sexually Assaulting 4-Year-Old Girl In Delhi: Cops
content: Delhi Police has arrested a 25-year-old man for allegedly sexually assaulting a four-year-old girl under the influence of alcohol in outernorth Delhi's Bawana, police said on Saturday.

title: 2 Bengaluru Senior Citizens Lose Rs 80.5 Lakh To Fake 'RBI Officials'
content: A man from Bengaluru was allegedly cheated of Rs 80,50,000 after unidentified callers posing as police officials and RBI personnel threatened him with a fabricated money laundering case.

title: Woman Student Attempts Setting Her Self Ablaze In Odisha, 5th Case In 6 Months
content: An undergraduate female student suffered about 90 per cent burn injuries after allegedly attemptingself-immolation in Odishas Sundergarh district, police said on Saturday.

title: Indian Investigators Head To US Next Week To Share Black Box Data: Report
content: India is sending investigators to the US next week to go over data with the National Transportation Safety Board gathered so far on the deadly crash in June of an Air India flight.

title: 38 high-risk districts in Rajasthan selected for drive against child marriage
content: Chittorgarh and Bhilwara districts have a child marriage prevalence of over 40%, while nine other districts have a 30% to 40% prevalence; NGO drive to focus on community efforts, legal interventions

title: 9th edition of Pariksha Pe Charcha to be held in January 2026, registrations open
content: ‚ÄúStudents, parents and teachers from India and abroad will engage with the Prime Minister to discuss exam stress and  celebrate examinations as an utsav [festival], as an integral part of life," says a senior official

title: Kerala‚Äôs first Gen Z post office opens at CMS College
content: Facility aims at creating a youth-friendly, tech-driven space that blends digital services, QR code-enabled features and upgraded amenities to engage younger users better

title: Uptick in admission of girls in MBBS course in Andhra Pradesh
content: Girls have secured 60.72% of this year‚Äôs admissions in the government and private medical colleges affiliated to Dr. NTR University of Health Sciences, says Health Minister Satya Kumar

title: Chander Kunj apartment resident moves contempt petition against Collector
content: The petitioner says the Collector failed to follow the directions in the judgment and evacuate the apartment, forcing him to live in an unsafe building under constant threat to life

title: Need stronger arbitral institutions for infrastructure sector: Supreme Court judge
content: Justice Bindal warned about challenges posed by AI in arbitration and litigation, including fabricated evidence, non-existent judgments, and confidentiality risks on open AI platforms.

title: When law lets down the defenceless
content: Activists, pointing to recent cases, call for setting up a robust monitoring mechanism to ensure proper implementation of the provisions of the Scheduled Castes and the Scheduled Tribes (Prevention of Atrocities) Act and its Rules. B. Tilak Chandar speaks to them about their concerns and the way forward

title: People near mines inhaling danger: Lok Sabha data flags lung harm; calls grow for tighter safeguards
content: Recent findings indicate that neighborhoods adjacent to Indian mining operations are experiencing significant lung health issues and exposure to heavy metals, reflecting the dangers faced by workers. Research highlights concerning levels of abnormal lung function and signs of fibrosis, even among children, underscoring the severe impact of dust pollution.

title: Failed to make 'adequate arrangements': DGCA summons IndiGo CEO; cites 'lapses' in planning
content: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers has received a show cause notice from aviation watchdog DGCA for mass flight disruptions since December 2. The notice cites alleged operational lapses and inadequate passenger support, demanding a response within 24 hours. A four-member committee has been formed to investigate the issue and recommend preventive measures.

title: Quad slams Red Fort blast, says bring culprits to justice
content: Quad nations have strongly condemned terrorism, including cross-border acts, and offered condolences for the Red Fort incident. Despite Quad summit delays, the group remains active, recently holding counterterrorism workshops and a tabletop exercise. Members emphasized information sharing and cooperation to keep the Indo-Pacific free from terror threats, with India and the US pushing for UN sanctions on terror groups.

title: India witnessing a ‚Äòpsychological renaissance‚Äô: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi declared India is experiencing a "psychological renaissance," shedding a colonial mindset that once labeled its slow growth the "Hindu rate of growth." He asserted the nation is now a global economic driver, lauded for its rapid development amidst a worldwide slowdown. This transformation, he emphasized, signifies a profound shift in national confidence and global standing.

title: ‚ÄòSC ruling on wedding gifts a win for all Muslim women‚Äô
content: A landmark Supreme Court ruling grants divorced Muslim women the right to reclaim wedding gifts from their parents.  Rousanara Begum's two-decade legal battle culminated in this victory, affirming women's dignity and property rights.  This precedent-setting judgment clarifies that gifts given to a bride belong to her, offering hope to many across India.

title: A softer side of Elon Musk: Ex-wife recalls Christmas with Tesla CEO
content: Elon Musk's ex-wife Talulah Riley shared how he expressed his love despite immense pressure running multiple companies.  Forgetting a Christmas gift, Musk braved the snow barefoot to retrieve flowers from frozen ground, demonstrating his deep affection.  Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang also praised Musk's early adoption of AI technology, highlighting his unique vision.

title: At Vatican observatory, Goa priest decoding cosmic past
content: Jesuit priest Fr Richard D‚ÄôSouza, a galactic archaeologist at the Vatican Observatory, studies galactic cannibalism. His 2018 research in Nature Astronomy revealed the Andromeda galaxy's major merger occurred two billion years ago. D‚ÄôSouza, who balances cosmic research with faith, now directs the historic observatory, reminding the Church of science and faith's synergy.

title: J&K exam age row erupts: Omar targets LG over delay; Raj Bhavan counters claim
content: A political spat has erupted over age relaxation for Jammu and Kashmir's civil services exam. Chief Minister Omar Abdullah accused Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha of delaying a crucial file, while the LG's office countered that misleading claims are circulating. Aspirants face uncertainty as the December 7 exam approaches, with student protests demanding an age limit increase.

title: Bengal SIR 1st phase almost over, 28L remain unmapped, may face EC hearing
content: As Bengal gears up for the finalization of its electoral roll, the digitization process has covered nearly all of the 7.6 crore voters. However, a significant number‚Äîapproximately 28-30 lakh‚Äîneed to attend hearings to clarify data inconsistencies and stay on the rolls. Furthermore, over 54 lakh voters are being eliminated due to reasons such as inaccessibility, death, or duplication.

title: Lessons in Leadership: Nvidia CEO to Cambridge students - Here's what he said
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang, honored with the Hawking Fellowship, shared leadership insights at Cambridge, emphasizing strategic sacrifice and unwavering conviction. He revealed seeing Nvidia's future vision early, stressing the importance of gut-checking assumptions and learning from failure. Huang described the CEO role as a lifetime of sacrifice, inspiring others through example rather than seeking personal glory.

title: Foundation for ‚ÄòBabri‚Äô masjid in West Bengal sparks political fire
content: A controversial foundation ceremony for a mosque, described as "Babri Masjid-styled," in Murshidabad on the anniversary of the 1992 demolition sparked political and communal tensions. Thousands attended the event organized by a suspended MLA, who declared it "emotional restitution." Political parties reacted sharply, with the TMC distancing itself and the BJP accusing it of vote bank politics.

title: Michael Jordan‚Äôs court appearance sparks huge fan reaction outside courthouse
content: Basketball legend Michael Jordan testified in court on December 5, 2025, regarding a legal matter involving his 23XI Racing team and NASCAR. Outside the courthouse, a large crowd gathered, with one fan's heartfelt shout of "I love you Michael Jordan, you're an icon man. You're the best!" going viral, reflecting his enduring global influence.

title: CM Soren bailed in ED summons case: Future appearance waived; hearing slated for Dec 12
content: In a significant development, Jharkhand's chief minister Hemant Soren has been granted bail by a special MP/MLA court amid allegations of ignoring summons from the Enforcement Directorate. Following directions from the Jharkhand High Court, Soren has appeared in court and submitted the necessary bail bonds, ensuring he won't have to attend further hearings unless specifically called upon.

title: ‚ÄòMetaverse‚Äô budget cut: Zuckerberg plans slash resources; company loses $70 billion
content: Meta is reportedly planning to significantly cut its Metaverse budget by up to 30% for 2026, signaling a potential shift away from its virtual reality ambitions. This move follows substantial losses and a lack of consumer interest in its VR products. The company is now prioritizing its artificial intelligence initiatives.

title: Biocon to merge biologics unit in $5.5 billion deal
content: Biocon has announced a bold step in the biopharmaceutical landscape by merging its biosimilars division, Biocon Biologics, into the parent organization for $5.5 billion. This ambitious strategy is designed to streamline operations and amplify its influence across global markets, especially in diabetes care, cancer treatment, and immune therapies.

title: Bareilly demolition halted by HC: ‚ÄòDue process first‚Äô; civic body told to hear residents
content: Allahabad High Court has halted the demolition of 27 homes in Bareilly's Shahabad area, emphasizing due process. Residents, who had been paying taxes for years, received notices declaring their homes illegal. The court directed the civic body to issue a reasoned order after a personal hearing, preventing any coercive action until then.

title: Satellite-based phone tracking under study: Privacy a hurdle; device makers, govt at odds
content: Government discussions are under way for mandatory satellite-assisted mobile phone tracking for law enforcement and disaster management. The proposal, stalled for five years due to privacy concerns and device maker reluctance, aims for more accurate location data than current tower-based methods. Manufacturers like Apple and Samsung are wary of potential misuse and insist on user consent for such pinpoint tracking.

title: LeBron James sends heartfelt 'family' message to fans after viral Toronto clip
content: LeBron James felt immense love from Toronto fans during the Lakers' recent game against the Raptors. The NBA legend, touched by the cheers and signs, called the fans "family" and expressed his deep appreciation for their unwavering support. He highlighted the special place Toronto holds in his heart, cherishing the warm welcome he always receives.

title: Conor McGregor calls out Islam Makhachev as he targets UFC 170-lb belt next
content: Conor McGregor eyes a UFC comeback in June 2025 at a White House event. He aims for Islam Makhachev's welterweight belt, seeking a historic triple crown. McGregor is training intensely. He also remains open to a fight with Michael Chandler. Contract talks are expected by February 2025. The UFC is finalizing plans for this significant return.

title: Sabalenka & Frangulis net worth: Earnings, endorsements and ventures
content: Tennis star Aryna Sabalenka and her boyfriend, Oakberry founder Georgios Frangulis, are a financially successful couple. Sabalenka boasts a net worth in the high teens of millions from her WTA career and endorsements, while Frangulis's stake in his rapidly expanding a√ßa√≠ company places him in the multi-million-dollar range. Their combined wealth is estimated to be in the tens of millions.

title: Customs overhaul next: FM vows cleaner, tech-led regime; duties may be cut further
content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced comprehensive reforms for Customs, aiming for greater transparency and simplified compliance.  Following successful Income Tax Act overhauls, the government plans to introduce technology for faster goods clearance and reduce discretionary powers.  Customs duties will also be reviewed and lowered where necessary, marking this as the next significant reform initiative.

title: One-day gap no ground to deny increment: HC rules for BSF retiree; dues to be released
content: In a landmark decision, the Punjab and Haryana high court has upheld the rights of a retired BSF inspector, affirming that a year of dedicated service cannot be dismissed based on a matter of mere hours. The court emphasized that increments earned are a testament to the hard work put in, not to be undermined by technicalities.

title: TN Deepam dispute heats up: DMK targets BJP; Nainar counters with ‚ÄòAyodhya‚Äô remark
content: A political spat erupted over the Karthigai Deepam lighting in Tirupparankundram, with DMK accusing BJP of inciting communal unrest. BJP state chief Nainar Nagenthran defended the move, stating there was no harm in the area resembling Ayodhya and dismissing fears of riots.

title: Bengal mosque row: Babur name political, says Ayodhya trust; urges rethink for harmony
content: The Indo-Islamic Cultural Foundation (IICF) has criticized suspended TMC MLA Humayun Kabir's plan to name a new mosque in West Bengal after Babur, calling it a politically motivated act that undermines the sacred purpose of worship.

title: Assam: Govt backs Tezpur university pro-VC pick; protests intensify
content: Tezpur University students blocked Union higher education secretary Vineet Joshi's convoy after a meeting on allegations against the "absconding" vice chancellor ended without action. Protests, now in their 79th day, demand the VC's resignation amid concerns over financial irregularities and questionable appointments. The ministry is examining the allegations and will report to the President.

title: IndiGo fiasco: The real cost of a flight that never took off
content: IndiGo's widespread flight cancellations and delays have plunged passengers into chaos, forcing them to scramble for alternative travel at exorbitant prices. The airline's operational crisis, marked by crew shortages, has led to significant passenger distress and a sharp decline in its stock value. Authorities are now intervening to control fares and ensure refunds.

title: India‚Äôs Russian oil imports set to hit 4-yr low; how long will the drop last?
content: India's Russian crude imports may hit a four-year low in January 2026 due to US sanctions, forcing refiners to seek alternatives. Despite pressure, Russia is exploring new channels, with potential for non-sanctioned oil flows to resume. India's strategic need for cost-effective energy and Russia's efforts to maintain trade suggest this dip might be temporary.

title: 'No right to interfere': Gambhir blasts IPL team owner for criticism over Tests loss
content: Gambhir said the reaction to the Test losses ignored key details. He said: "There were so many things said and written after we lost the Test series against South Africa, but nobody wrote or spoke about the fact that in the first Test we played without our captain."

title: IVF pushes 9 in 10 couples into catastrophic debt
content: A new study reveals nearly 90% of Indian couples undergoing IVF face catastrophic expenditure, even in public hospitals, with costs averaging Rs 1.1 lakh. Over half borrow money, and only 5% have limited insurance, highlighting a significant financial crisis driven by infertility treatments.

title: IndiGo cancellations: How to track flight & refund status online; step-by-step guide
content: IndiGo is recovering from massive flight cancellations, operating over 1500 flights today after a Friday with 1600 disruptions. New pilot duty rules caused the chaos, impacting over 1,000 flights. The airline has received temporary relief from DGCA. Passengers can track flight and refund status online, with refunds mandated by Sunday evening.

title: First since 2013 - Rohit, Yashasvi end this 12-year drought against Proteas
content: This was India‚Äôs 10th century opening stand against South Africa in ODIs, and the first since Rohit Sharma and Shikhar Dhawan put on 127 in the Champions Trophy 2013 match in Cardiff.

title: South Africa shooting: Gunmen open fire at illegal Pretoria bar; 12 killed
content: Gunmen opened fire at an illegal bar in Pretoria's Saulsville township early Saturday, killing at least 12 people, including a three-year-old child and two teenagers. Police reported 25 people were shot in the indiscriminate attack, which is the latest in a string of mass shootings plaguing South Africa. The motive is unknown, and a manhunt is underway for the suspects.

title: Aaron Rodgers rumored to join Packers rival if he returns for 2026 season
content: Aaron Rodgers has signed a one-year deal with the Steelers for 2025, his final NFL season.  Despite impressive stats, Pittsburgh's playoff chances are uncertain.  If Rodgers plays in 2026, rumors suggest a move to the Vikings, driven by his friendship with coach Kevin O'Connell and a desire to emulate Brett Favre's career path.

title: ‚ÄòNot going anywhere‚Äô: Rohit Sharma gets backing; India seal series 2-1
content: Rohit Sharma achieved his 61st ODI fifty and 20,000 international runs. He scored 75 runs in the match against South Africa. Former cricketers Mohammad Kaif and Irfan Pathan praised his performance. India won the match by nine wickets and secured the series. Rohit's consistent form at 38 years old was highlighted.

title: IND vs SA: Rare feat! Jaiswal joins Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli in elite list
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal's maiden ODI century, an unbeaten 116, powered India to a series-clinching victory over South Africa in the third ODI. Supported by Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, India comfortably chased down 271 with over 10 overs to spare. Jaiswal also became the sixth Indian to score centuries in all three international formats.

title: Yashasvi Jaiswal celebrates maiden ODI ton; India thrash SA to clinch series 2-1
content: Yashasvi Jaiswal struck his maiden ODI century, an unbeaten 116, as India comfortably chased 271 to defeat South Africa by nine wickets and clinch the series 2-1. Rohit Sharma also contributed 75, while Kuldeep Yadav and Prasidh Krishna took four wickets each to restrict the visitors. This victory follows India's Test series defeat.

title: Private bedroom CCTV hacked: Surat woman‚Äôs video leaked online; couple faces trauma
content: A Surat couple is in distress after intimate videos of the wife, recorded by home CCTV cameras, went viral online. The incident raises concerns about the security of home surveillance systems. Police are investigating potential hacking or unauthorized sharing of the footage, with cases registered under the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and IT Act.

title: Reverse Kidney Damage: A breakthrough treatment transform kidney treatment
content: A groundbreaking discovery offers hope for reversing kidney damage, challenging the notion that it's irreversible. Researchers found that blocking ceramides, fats linked to kidney cell injury, protected and restored normal function in animal trials. This breakthrough could shift kidney disease treatment from slowing decline to actively restoring health, potentially reducing the need for dialysis and transplantation.

title: Rs 970 crore scam: How 400‚Äì500 investors across India and Dubai were duped
content: Kanpur police have arrested Ravindra Nath Soni, a Delhi-based businessman. He allegedly ran a massive international investment scam. Hundreds of Indians in India and Dubai were duped of nearly ‚Çπ970 crore. The fraud involves cryptocurrency laundering and hawala routes. Investigators are examining national security implications. Soni floated shell companies promising high returns. He is now in judicial custody.

title: Is Connor McDavid playing tonight vs Jets? Latest Dec 6 update
content: Connor McDavid is expected to play for the Edmonton Oilers against the Winnipeg Jets on December 6. Following a hat trick in their last game, McDavid's elite playmaking and scoring instincts are crucial for Edmonton's momentum. His presence at Rogers Place promises a high-intensity matchup as the Oilers aim to climb the standings.

title: Trumpiana: Pardons, power play and a peace prize at last!
content: Donald Trump, frustrated by a lack of executive orders, attempted to nullify Biden's pardons via social media. He then engaged in a prolific posting spree and appeared to nap during a cabinet meeting where he made controversial remarks. Amidst these events, Trump issued pardons to a former Honduran president and a Democratic representative, while also receiving a FIFA "peace prize."

title: 'Chal wapas ja!': Kuldeep gets schooled by Rohit and Kohli during DRS drama - watch
content: During India's series-clinching ODI against South Africa, Rohit Sharma, despite not captaining, humorously intervened to prevent Kuldeep Yadav from taking unnecessary DRS reviews.  Sharma, supported by Virat Kohli, repeatedly signaled against reviews, showcasing a blend of humor and strategic insight that ultimately proved correct, as Kuldeep later admitted his reliance on such guidance.

title: No calls and emails after office hours: Right to Disconnect Bill introduced in Lok Sabha
content: A new bill in India's Parliament proposes a legal 'right to disconnect' for employees, aiming to establish clear boundaries between work and personal life. Introduced by MP Supriya Sule, the 'Right to Disconnect Bill, 2025' seeks to prevent employers from demanding responses outside official hours, addressing issues like burnout and sleep deprivation.

title: Trapped in the Matrix: How TikTok, Shorts, and Reels are destroying your mind
content: Short-form video wasn‚Äôt supposed to become our generation‚Äôs Matrix, yet here we are, scrolling ourselves into a new cognitive baseline. Drawing on Feeds, Feelings and Focus, a meta-analysis of 71 studies and nearly 100,000 people, this piece maps how TikTok, Reels and Shorts quietly retrain the mind. Attention thins, emotions accelerate, adults prove no more resilient than teenagers, autonomy erodes in micro-increments, and identity becomes whatever narrative the algorithm reflects back. No machines, no pods, no cables ‚Äî just a device we willingly consult. The dreamworld didn‚Äôt need to trap us. We walked in, thumb first, without noticing the door.

title: Luka Doncic shares adorable photo as he welcomes his second daughter
content: Luka Doncic is celebrating the arrival of his second daughter, Olivia, in Slovenia. The NBA star missed recent Lakers games for this joyous family event.  His fianc√©e, Anamaria Goltes, also shared touching messages.  Their first daughter, Gabriela, was born in 2023, making December a special birth month for both children.

title: Rohit joins Sachin, Kohli, Dravid in elite list; ticks major career milestone
content: Rohit Sharma achieved a significant milestone, becoming the fourth Indian batter to surpass 20,000 runs in men's international cricket. He reached the landmark during the third ODI against South Africa. This achievement places him in elite company alongside Sachin Tendulkar, Virat Kohli, and Rahul Dravid.

title: The Playbook: Shadow Reports, lineup locks for Week 14
content: this column features score projections, over/unders, win probabilities, and easily digestible fantasy advice for seasonlong leagues and DFS . this guide should help you with all sorts of decision-making, including sit/start, last-minute waiver adds and lineup choices .

title: üèà CFB recruiting: Top 75 schools for 2026
content: USC has put itself in position to snap the five-cycle streak of SEC teams finishing with the No. 1-ranked class . some programs, including the no. 1 overall player, Lamar Brown, remain unsigned . there are still questions to be answered and opportunities to make a move in the 2026 class rankings .

title: Who has the most work to do? Where all 30 teams stand ahead of winter meetings
content: the focus is shifting to every team's retooling effort for 2026 . it's going to have a tough act to follow . the heavy lifting of this hot stove season still lies ahead . for now, we'll check in with our first offseason stock watch .

title: College football Champ Week live updates: CFP takeaways for every game
content: the college football playoff field will impact their final ranking on selection day . we're tracking all the conference title games and the impact on the CFP field . it doesn't matter if the committee keeps it at No. 11 or drops it to No. 12 .

title: Key intel on the games that could decide three division races
content: no division winners will be crowned this week in the NFL . three games Sunday could go a long way toward deciding who wins the NFC North and a pair of divisions in the AFC . the three first-place showdowns are the Chicago Bears (9-3-1) at Green Bay Packers (8-3) at Jacksonville Jaguars (8-4) in the aFC South and Pittsburgh Steelers (6-6) in the Baltimore Ravens .

title: UFC 323 expert picks, best bets: Can Merab or Pantoja be stopped?
content: merab Dvalishvili will defend his bantamweight title for the fourth time this year . the nine-year veteran from the country of Georgia is taking on former champion Petr Yan . if he gets his hand raised for the 15th consecutive time on Saturday, he'll become the first UFC fighter to win four title fights in a calendar year. pound-for-pound competitor, Alexandre Pantoja (30-5), puts his men's flyweight belt on the line in the co-
